speaker: ['Monica Geller']
transcript: So, I'll get candles and my mom's lace tablecloth, and since it's Rachel's birthday, I mean, we want it to be special, I thought I'd poach a salmon.

speaker: ['#ALL#']
transcript: Ohhh.

speaker: ['Monica Geller']
transcript: What?

speaker: ['Ross Geller']
transcript: Question. Why do we always have to have parties where you poach things?

speaker: ['Monica Geller']
transcript: You wanna be in charge of the food committee?

speaker: ['Ross Geller']
transcript: Question two. Why do we always have to have parties with committees?

speaker: ['Joey Tribbiani']
transcript: Really. Why can't we just get some pizzas and get some beers and have fun?

speaker: ['Ross Geller']
transcript: Yeah.

speaker: ['Phoebe Buffay']
transcript: Yeah, I agree. Ya know, I think fancy parties are only fun if you're fancy on the inside and I'm just not sure we are.

speaker: ['Monica Geller']
transcript: Alright. If you guys don't want it to be special, fine. You can throw any kind of party you want.

speaker: ['Monica Geller']
transcript: Joey they're not real. I start miles beneath the surface of these things, ok, they're fake. See honk honk.

speaker: ['Chandler Bing']
transcript: Wow, it's, it's like porno for clowns.

speaker: ['Ross Geller']
transcript: I talked to Rachel's sisters, neither of them can come.

speaker: ['Monica Geller']
transcript: Ok, um so, I still have to invite Dillon and Emma and Shannon Cooper.

speaker: ['Joey Tribbiani']
transcript: Woah, woah, woah, uh, no Shannon Cooper.

speaker: ['Phoebe Buffay']
transcript: Why not her?

speaker: ['Joey Tribbiani']
transcript: Cause she uh, she steals stuff.

speaker: ['Chandler Bing']
transcript: Or maybe she doesn't steal stuff and Joey just slept with her and never called her back.

speaker: ['Monica Geller']
transcript: Joey that is horriable.

speaker: ['Joey Tribbiani']
transcript: Hey I liked her, alright. Maybe, maybe too much. I don't know I guess I just got scared.

speaker: ['Phoebe Buffay']
transcript: I'm sorry, I didn't know.

speaker: ['Joey Tribbiani']
transcript: I didn't think anyone'd buy that, ok.

speaker: ['Ross Geller']
transcript: Hi honey, how did it go?

speaker: ['Rachel Green']
transcript: Agh, it was the graduation from hell.

speaker: ['Chandler Bing']
transcript: Ya know, my cousin went to hell on a football scholarship.

speaker: ['Rachel Green']
transcript: Ya know, I mean this is supposed to be a joyous occasion. My sister's graduating from college, nobody thought she would. It's a true testament to what a girl from long island would do for a Celica.

speaker: ['Monica Geller']
transcript: So what happened?

speaker: ['Rachel Green']
transcript: My parents happened. All they had to do was sit in the same stadium, smile proudly, and not talk about the divorce. But nooo, they got into a huge fight in the middle of the commencement address. Bishop Tutu actually had to stop and shush them. But you know what, you know what the good news is? I get to serve coffee for the next 8 hours.

speaker: ['Phoebe Buffay']
transcript: Ok, so I guess we don't invite her parents.

speaker: ['Monica Geller']
transcript: Well, how bout just her mom?

speaker: ['Chandler Bing']
transcript: Why her mom?

speaker: ['Monica Geller']
transcript: Cause I already invited her.

speaker: ['Phoebe Buffay']
transcript: Ooh, ooh, did you ask Stacy Roth?

speaker: ['Joey Tribbiani']
transcript: Oh no, can't invite her. She also steals.

speaker: ['Chandler Bing']
transcript: Ok, ok, you can be shirts and I'll be skins. I'll be skins. Hey, how you holdin' up there, tiger? Oh, sorry, when my parents were getting divorced I got a lot of tigers. Got a lot of champs, chiefs, sports, I even got a governor.

speaker: ['Rachel Green']
transcript: This is it, isn't it? I mean, this is what my life is gonna be like. My mom there, my dad there. Thanksgiving, Christmas. She gets the house, he's in some condo my sister's gonna decorate with wicker. Oh, Chandler how did you get through this?

speaker: ['Chandler Bing']
transcript: Well, I relied on a carefully regimented program of denial and, and wetting the bed.

speaker: ['Rachel Green']
transcript: Ya know, I just, so weird. I mean I was in there just listening to them bitch about each other and all I kept thinking about was the fourth of July.

speaker: ['Chandler Bing']
transcript: Becasue it reminded you of the way our forefathers used to bitch at each other?

speaker: ['Rachel Green']
transcript: It's just this thing. Every year we would go out on my dad's boat and watch the fireworks. Mom always hated it because the ocean air made her hair all big. My sister Jill would be throwing up over the side and my dad would be upset becasue nobody was helping and then when we did help he would scream at us for doing it wrong. But then when the fireworks started, everybody just shut up, you know, and it'd get really cold, and we would all just sort of smush under this one blanket. It never occured to anybody to bring another one. And now it's just...

speaker: ['Chandler Bing']
transcript: I, I know.

speaker: ['Monica Geller']
transcript: Ok, thanks for coming, I hope you guys had fun.

speaker: ['Sandra Green']
transcript: Alright, Monica dear, I'm gonna hit the road. Now I've left my 10 verbs on the table. And you be sure and send me that finished poem.

speaker: ['Monica Geller']
transcript: Ok will do. So glad you came.

speaker: ['Sandra Green']
transcript: I think I saw Rachel out in the hall.

speaker: ['Monica Geller']
transcript: Ok, let me go check. Your mom want's to say goodbye.

speaker: ['Rachel Green']
transcript: Oh ok.

speaker: ['Sandra Green']
transcript: Happy birthday sweetie.

speaker: ['Rachel Green']
transcript: Ok.

speaker: ['Joey Tribbiani']
transcript: Ahh, you drive safe.

speaker: ['Sandra Green']
transcript: Ross, what're you doing.

speaker: ['Ross Geller']
transcript: I'm getting ready for the water skiing. How are you doing?

speaker: ['Chandler Bing']
transcript: Well, uh, Dr. Greene, where are you going?

speaker: ['Leonard Green']
transcript: To get my coat.

speaker: ['Guys']
transcript: No no no.

speaker: ['Leonard Green']
transcript: Alright, alright, I can get my own coat.

speaker: ['Chandler Bing']
transcript: Sorry, we're on a major flan high.

speaker: ['Phoebe Buffay']
transcript: Oh no, you're not supposed to be here. This is the staging area, you should, it's all wrong, you should leave, ya know, get out. Or perhaps you'd like a creme d'menthe.

speaker: ['Leonard Green']
transcript: I have to be heading to my chateau, thank you.

speaker: ['Phoebe Buffay']
transcript: Oh all right, then I guess we're going back into the hallway.

speaker: ['Joey Tribbiani']
transcript: Thanks for coming Mrs. Greene. Well, ok, you take care.

speaker: ['Sandra Green']
transcript: Oh, you kids Well, this is the best party I've been to in years.

speaker: ['Monica Geller']
transcript: Thank you.

speaker: ['Monica Geller']
transcript: Ok everybody, it's time for flan.

speaker: ['Chandler Bing']
transcript: Yup, get ready for the gelatenous fun.

speaker: ['Joey Tribbiani']
transcript: Kinda looks like that stuff you get when you get a bad infection.

speaker: ['Monica Geller']
transcript: Ok, that's enough.

speaker: ['Phoebe Buffay']
transcript: Ok Rachel, make a special flan wish.

speaker: ['Rachel Green']
transcript: Ok, I've got one. Wow, those things almost never come true.
